block.para: Let us analyze what the concepts of monomorphism, epimorphism, and isomorphism actually mean.
Epimorphism Suppose L is an epimorphism. Now, if \Vect{y}\in W is arbitrary, there is at least one \Vect{x}\in V with L(\Vect{x}) = \Vect{y}.
In other words, the transform of V inside W fills all of W. – Note, however, that while L transforms V to cover W, it is possible that L collapses parts of V to single points.
